newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish CD rate cut follows European trend - central bank.
newsitem.headline: Danish CD rate cut follows European trend - central bank.

text.p: Denmark's central bank said on Friday the general trend in key European nations to cut rates lay behind its decision to trim the 14-day CD rate by 0.20 point to 3.50 percent.
"We have reduced (the 14-day CD) rate in the wake of cuts by key European nations." a central bank spokeswoman told Reuters.
The certificate of deposit (CD) cut, expected to be followed automatically by an identical repurchase (repo) reduction next Thursday, was the ninth this year, the last was on June 6.
The key deposit and discount rate, cut three times so far this year, was left unchanged at 3.25 pct. +45-33969652
